Text saved: "The Life of Pi" tells a very special story. It is about a teenage boy from India. His name is Pi. His ship sinks in the Pacific Ocean. He is on a small boat with a very dangerous tiger. A Canadian author named Yann Martel wrote the book. It is his third book. The book came out in 2001. It sold more than seven million copies all over the world. It also won many prizes. People can read the book in 41 languages. Martel's father was a diplomat. A diplomat is a person who works for his country in other countries. When Martel was a child, he lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France and Mexico.

metadata.feedback_text: FAILED. The text introduces the C1 level word 'diplomat'. According to the rules, the introduction of complex terms, even if they are explained, is an immediate failure. The goal is to use vocabulary the learner already knows, not to teach new words. The sentence should have been rewritten to convey the meaning without using the advanced vocabulary. For example: 'Martel's father worked for his country in other countries.' This single violation is critical and makes the text unacceptable.
